com.parkit.parkingsystem.dao

Class TicketDAO

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.parkit.parkingsystem.dao.TicketDAO

  • public class TicketDAO
extends java.lang.Object
    TicketDAO class is built to stock Ticket Data.

    DAO means "Data Access Object". It use to separate how we stock data with the main code. So if stocking Data method change, only functional class will have be to changed.

    Version:
    3.0
    Author:
    Frederic VO
    See Also:
    DataBaseConfig, DBConstants, ParkingType, ParkingSpot, Ticket

    • Method Detail

      • saveTicket

        public boolean saveTicket(Ticket ticket)
        saveTicket() is built to save ticket in DataBase. In a try/catch/finally instruction, it will :
        • getConnection from Database in MySQL
        • use prepareStatement of saving a ticket
        • run query
        • close connection
        Parameters:
        ticket - Ticket
        Returns:
        false
        Since:
        1.0

      • getTicket

        public Ticket getTicket(java.lang.String vehicleRegNumber)
        getTicket() is built to get ticket in DataBase. In a try/catch/finally instruction, it will :
        • getConnection from Database in MySQL
        • use prepareStatement of getting a ticket with the vehicle's Id (regNumber)
        • if exist, run query
        • close ResultSet
        • close PreparedStatement
        • return ticket
        • close connection
        Parameters:
        vehicleRegNumber - Id of vehicle
        Returns:
        ticket Ticket
        Since:
        1.0

      • updateTicket

        public boolean updateTicket(Ticket ticket)
        updateTicket() is built to update ticket in DataBase. In a try/catch/finally instruction, it will :
        • getConnection from Database in MySQL
        • use prepareStatement of updating ticket
        • run query
        • close connection
        Parameters:
        ticket - Ticket
        Returns:
        false
        Since:
        1.0

      • recurrentCustomer

        public boolean recurrentCustomer(java.lang.String vehicleRegNumber)
        reccurentCustomer() is built to verify if a customer is recurrent in DataBase. In a try/catch/finally instruction, it will :
        • getConnection from Database in MySQL
        • use prepareStatement of getting recurrent customer ticket
        • If exist, run query
        • close ResultSet
        • close PreparedStatement
        • close connection
        Parameters:
        vehicleRegNumber - Id of vehicle
        Returns:
        recurrent if true or false
        Since:
        3.0
